The interior felt like I was in the vintage 90s but the excellent service of the crew well made up for it. Flight arrived ahead of schedule. A couple of years I avoided Qantas's flights because of previous unpleasant international flight experiences with them but it appears that they have improved their standards substantially for their domestic flights.

Flew Premium Economy LAX to SYD. Flight left on time which was nice to have after some disasters on American carriers trying to get to LAX. Both the meals dinner and breakfast were fine as was the in-flight entertainment. The staff on the flight were polite efficient and very pleasant to deal with. My only complaint is the recline in premium economy which in my opinion goes too far back as it makes eating watching movies and getting out of the seat almost impossible for the person behind. In my case the less than considerate passenger seated in front of me decided to go to sleep just before both meals forcing me to eat in a contortionist manner. The very lovely flight attendant looking after me tried on both occasions to assist with no luck.

JFK-LAX-MEL in economy. This trip turned into a nightmare due to an unimaginable 'operations' decision that adversely impacted the travel plans of 50-100 passengers. As background QF runs the JFK-LAX flight for passengers going onwards to Sydney Melbourne and Brisbane. It is a huge convenience as there is no need to change terminals at LAX no need to go through TSA security a second time and generally better to fly QF transcontinental USA than the US carriers except on this night. That said the JFK-LAX flight on this particular evening was running about one hour behind schedule due to late arrival of the aircraft and typical JFK evening delays - this isn't all that unusual and the delay not all that long. For inexplicable reasons however Qantas chose not to hold the LAX-MEL flight for all of the passengers on the JFK-LAX flight who were Melbourne bound. Even with the one hour delay on the domestic leg we still arrived LAX before the scheduled departure time of the overseas leg and the LAX-MEL flight was running 30 minutes behind as well so Qantas had no legitimate reason not to hold the flight for another 30 minutes or so to get all Melbourne passengers on board. This forced all 50-100 of us to fly a packed B747 instead of the more comfortable A380 lost seat assignments and change planes in Sydney which is more complicated than you would think (domestic and international terminals aren't close and there is no easy from one to the other) and even worse added approximately five hours to the trip. It is inexcusable and Qantas has been unapologetic and unresponsive to emails I've written them about their decisions on that evening. It is no wonder that their international business is suffering - on this evening they disrupted the travel plans and offended 50-100 passengers with one very poor decision.

I found four things seriously wrong with Qantas First Class. 1) The "Chauffeur Drive" service. Arriving in Sydney at 6.30am having booked a car I was surprised to be told (after finally locating the tiny unmarked desk) that there was a 15-20 minute wait until a car was available. Why? How? A car was booked. It should have been there end of story. Also in the car before my the previous flight (Sydney-London) I was delighted to receive an expletive-laden tirade across the driver's radio - apparently from one of his colleagues having a bad day. That is not "first class". 2) Baggage. Qantas advertises that First Class bags will be "among the first" to be delivered off the plane. On arrival in Sydney mine were among the last (both turning up on the carousel a full 50 minutes after landing; I do not remember the timing in London). 3) The breakfast. Scrambled eggs were dry. Avocado was unripe. Pancakes were also dry and overcooked. Coffee was weak and burnt. That is all. 4) The champagne. Qantas advertises three varieties. On every leg of the Sydney-London return trip the only one available was the Taittinger blanc de blancs. Methinks these are phantoms included in the wine list solely for appearances.

Recently travelled SYD - Cairns direct and Cairns-Brisbane-Sydney return. Very disappointed on all flights. The food was some of the worst I have had on any flight for a number of years. With three meals in all the most I was able to stomach at each sitting was one mouth full. Entertainment on the Sydney - Cairns leg was a supplied ipad unit which didn't work. The Cairns - Brisbane leg seemed to be a newer plane with inseat screens which worked well and the final Brisbane-Sydney leg had nothing. For full service flights Qantas needs to make a massive improvement if it wants to be taken seriously.

An eight hour wait at Changi airport I assume because it's more important to Qantas to fill their plane to capacity than it is to schedule enough services to avoid excessive waiting times. The inflight service was awful. I'm a vegetarian so get meals served before other passengers and I can only assume this is a crime on Qantas flights. On Flight QF52 from Changi on Saturday 20/09/2014 I got my meal slapped in front of me about an hour into the flight and then the tray sat there for around two hours whilst everyone else was served and their trays collected. I would guess I was probably the last passenger to have their tray taken away. By the time one of the stewardesses took the tray I had back pain and was cramped from being trapped in one position for so long. Likewise I got my breakfast shoved at me before everyone else too and what a breakfast - a stale croissant and a sachet of awful tasting marmalade. I was given only a spoon with which to slice my stale croissant and spread the marmalade and when I requested a knife and a sachet of butter I was grudgingly given the knife but butter was obviously out of the question. Personally I think passengers seated near babies should be given a decent discount because it's simply unfair to be forced to spend long flights being prevented from sleep by crying babies. I first flew with Qantas about 10 years ago and swore never again back then but my travel agent talked me into giving them another go. Never again!

Flew from Singapore to Sydney. There was no reason why the plane left late as it was sitting at the gate four hours before departure. The plane left 30 minutes late and by the time we got to Sydney it was put into a holding pattern because it was late. By the time it landed it was nearly an hour late. Because of this we and many others missed connecting flights. Qantas on time performance is a joke. They got us to Singapore an hour late and nearly matched it on the way back. Going through customs we explained the situation to the officer and he said most Qantas planes were late. If you need a connecting flight steer well clear of Qantas as you will miss it. Is it any wonder Qantas is losing money hand over fist.

Perth - Dubai - Stockholm then Heathrow - Dubai - Perth. On a Qantas ticket but code shared with Emirates. 3 legs on Emirates B777 1 leg on QFA380. Contrast between Qantas and Emirates is very stark. QF not quite "sit down shut up and don't bother us" - but that's what it felt like. Emirates Business Class consistently high standard. Personal greetings and introductions nothing too much trouble. Food and beverages excellent. Lounges excellent especially in Perth. Emirates Business seats are slightly narrow for sleeping but overall good. The lesson is - get a QF ticket to get the points and status credits but fly on Emirates code share planes to get the service.

May 5 and 6 my parents and I travelled from Perth to Lax via Sydney for a holiday to US. We travelled on an Airbus 330-200 and B747-400 ER and were upgraded to business class on QF 107 SYD to LAX which was excellent and the food and service great. We travelled home from Hawaii via Sydney in economy class on our way home from mainland US on QF 4 and QF 577. We can recommend Qantas as a great airline to use for trips to the USA and within Australia.

Due to fly QF8006 Business to BNE via Dubai. No airline communication but Chauffeur rang to ask us if we knew anything about flight being cancelled. No. Rang Qantas who knew nothing and then Emirates who knew less (Codeshare). Eventually transpires mechanical problem with Airbus delay at least until 11.45 am (departure due 22.15 today). We need to get to BNE so suggest less attractive flight available (with seats and originally lower cost) from BHX or MAN. QF say Emirates unwilling to reroute us Emirates say unable to alter as only QF have the ability to do this! An hour spent on telephone to all corners of the globe and finally both QF and EK agreed they need to do something and we should wait. Number given for direct contact. No call from either airline but chauffeur rings us to ask if we know what is happening (No) and arranges to pick us up at 4.30 am to get to Heathrow. So arrive at least 13 hours late in Dubai means we miss connecting BNE flight (only one per day) and arrive at best 24 hours later than planned. An extra 24 hours travelling. Do you think we will use QF/EK again? Zero communication ability from airlines.

QF581 from Sydney to Perth on Sunday 14 Sep. The quality has disappeared the food was poor with the highlights being the cheese and biscuits both hot meals were awful and we almost fought over my sons burrito he bought at the airport. Entertainment was like in the 90s with several shared screens no personal TVs and we were informed that only business class and above had the individual q streaming. Last time on this flight we had ipads - obviously another cost saving courtesy of management. As for the staff poor would be an understatement. On the flight from Perth to Sydney staff obviously wanted to be elsewhere.

QF581 from Sydney to Perth on Sunday 14 Sep. The quality has disappeared the food was poor with the highlights being the cheese and biscuits both hot meals were awful and we almost fought over my sons burrito he bought at the airport. Entertainment was like in the 90s with several shared screens no personal TVs and we were informed that only business class and above had the individual q streaming. Last time on this flight we had ipads - obviously another cost saving courtesy of management. As for the staff poor would be an understatement. On the flight from Perth to Sydney staff obviously wanted to be elsewhere.

QF98 Hong Kong to Brisbane (Overnight Flight). This flight left around 20 minutes later than it should due to airport issues. Captain kept everyone fully informed which was good. Flight crew provided prompt and excellent service which given it was an overnight flight was very good. Meal served after 40 minutes in the air giving passengers around 7 hours sleep. Aircraft was only half full so pretty much everyone had a spare seat next to them so they could stretch out a bit. I managed to get around 6 hours sleep in which is pretty good for me in economy as I'm tall (having the extra space really helped). Food was very good although the breakfast pastry was bland. IFE was totally pathetic IFE Screen only 10cm in size and the current selection of movies and music was simply appalling. You get much better IFE on domestic flights so lift your game Qantas. Aircraft seat got pretty hard after 9 hours flying and the aircraft is looking old needs to be revamped shortly. We all got through Brisbane Immigration quite quickly only to be held up for ages waiting for baggage to come through this is another area that needs improving upon in Brisbane.

I've been a Qantas frequent flyer for a number of years now and fly with them domestic for the most part. For international flights I avoid them like the plague as they are expensive and the service is sub par. This particular flight was BKK-SYD and I was just relieved I was able to secure an aisle seat (with the added bonus of the spot next to me being unoccupied). Online check in was not available for this flight for some mysterious reason. The cabin crew need a lesson in grooming and customer service ASAP. All of them looked bored and somewhat angry. The service as usual was disinterested and disconnected. Breakfast was just thrown at the passengers. One of the ladies looked like she just rolled out of bed and one of the male attendants needs to shave so as one doesn't look like they've been awake for 24 hours. The food service was mediocre (as usual). Most notable was their 'breakfast' which was a small muffin yoghurt and orange juice. Please note that in their domestic flights (ie SYD-MEL) this is almost the same amount of food that's served. In a 9 hour flight with a 4 hour gap between the dinner and breakfast service one is left rather starving.

My wife and I did a trip from Perth to Brisbane (return) on business class because it was 5+ hours. The seating was no better than Economy class only a few rows behind us. Difference being we paid over $7500 for our seats and Economy would have been under $1000 for the same trip. The plane was an A330-200 and had recently been changed from Jetstar (budget airline) according to a steward on board. We do a lot of International trips out of Perth in Business Class now we know why we choose Singapore Air Air NZ or Mauritius Air. Qantas has poor seating and service.

This is a very short flight scheduled time 55 minutes but in practice it's more like 30 minutes so one would expect things to go smoothly. And smoothly go it did. I checked in online on my phone no paper needed had no baggage so it was more like catching a bus than a plane. Literally walked through security had a drink and onto the plane. Everything was on time and worked like clockwork. On that 30 minute flight they managed to serve everyone (about 100+ passengers) with a delicious sandwich and beverage of choice; mine a glass of wine - included in the fare. I noticed some people even got seconds. It's also worth mentioning the service was professional but more importantly very friendly; perfection. I almost wish the flight was longer.

QF1 Sydney to London on August 23. A380 in good clean condition. Seats comfortable with good footrest/net that compensated a little for the 31" seat pitch. Not exactly class-leading for long-haul. Food and drink service was fine. Crew were efficient and friendly. IFE was good. In all it was a pleasant flight on a great quiet aircraft. I had not travelled long-haul with Qantas for some years and while there was nothing particularly wrong with the flight my journey home was QF-ticketed but operated by an Emirates A380. Their little extras highlighted that QF international is not the benchmark.

PER-SYD-LAX. We flew this extremely long flight last week. The service from the time we left Perth until we touched down in Los Angeles was outstanding. The meals were of great quality. We used our frequent flyer points to upgrade us to Business Class and were so glad we did.

DFW-BNE-SYD on 9/8-10/14 in Business Class upper deck of 747. Excellent flight in every respect: spacious seat layout very comfortable seats in all positions but particularly in sleep mode good food especially the late night supper. Flight attendants were experienced and efficient friendly and accommodating. Video selections a bit odd but interesting with plenty of choices. New crew and another breakfast from Brisbane to Sydney equally good. Qantas lounges in DFW and Brisbane were fine. Luggage on the carousel before we arrived after a fast pass through immigration.

Sydney-Dallas QF007 on September 5 2014. Paying a premium for QF Premium Economy and looking at their website - I must say I was expecting something exceptional. This was not the case. 747-400 Seat 36K is said to be one of the best seats but if you are 6ft+ then this is not the case. The wall in front means you actually have less leg room than standard economy. The cabin was 100% full and the single toilet was used consistently especially by QF staff as their rest area was adjacent to it. Meals etc were quite good however it seemed economy passengers were offered ice cream/chocolates etc mid flight - but we were not (minor issue I know but at double the price I expected more). Was never offered a drink (except at meal times). An exit seat in economy would have saved me $2000 and been of better value I feel.

Flew business class Melbourne up to Sydney on 767 then over to Dallas on 747 seat 14A upstairs in the bubble. Then Dallas to Brisbane on 747 seat 3A in the nose then onto Melbourne in 737 again all business. Sydney - Dallas - Brisbane business class was excellent. First time on long haul business - the service the food and the seats were great. The attention that we received from the crew on all legs was good. The holiday started from the moment we boarded even the domestic flight up to Sydney. We travelled on points so got a good deal money wise what would other wise be in excess of $7000 return. It will be hard to return to the back of the bus.

Flew A380 LA to Melbourne night flight economy. Crew polite but disinterested. Food dull - Special K for the cold breakfast. Not enough water offered. Lots of movies but screen scratched so not much fun (this is the third time in a row I have had a dodgy screen with Qantas). No footrests arm rests do not go up completely and do not lock in the up position. Excellent landings (twice as had to divert to Sydney due to fog). Cabin crew did not offer water during 2 hour diversion.

Melbourne - Brisbane 6 August. Departure 4 pm. Economy. Very friendly courteous service. The food was a bit skimpy for a 2 hour flight. Just some dry biscuits. The free wine was very much appreciated.
Brisbane to Melbourne. 10 August. Evening flight. Very friendly service. A tasty meal was also included. I also appreciated the good quality IFE.

Flew Business Class on 20th August Sydney to Manila. I haven't flown Qantas long haul for some time and I must say that I was pleasantly surprised. The inflight service from the cabin crew was outstanding. From the service manager down nothing was too much trouble and everything was done with a smile. The drink service and the meals were first class. The meals were of exceptional quality. Seating was comfortable and soon will be even better with the A330 being upgraded to lie flat seats. Communication from the flight deck was very good and certainly portrays a very comfortable and secure feeling to passengers. Well done Qantas I will certainly fly with them again.

Flew MEL to PER 1/09/14. Had some concerns pre-flight because my mother is recovering from a major back operation. Could not have asked for better service. From check-in at Melbourne to bag collection at Perth the quality of service was exceptional. Especially the flight staff who paid my mother the utmost attention did everything possible to relieve her anxieties about flying and made the trip as pleasant for her as possible. The seats were comfortable enough although a little more shoulder room would have been appreciated. The person next to me took the liberty o spreading out as much as he could and took up not only the left side armrest but also the one between us leaving me with sitting in as cramped a position as possible. The food was good - just the right size serving for a mid-range flight of four hours. Ice cream was offered as well which was a nice treat. Inflight entertainment was good and varied. Didn't use it myself but noticed others around me using it. Thanks again to the wonderful flight attendants - they really made the trip a most enjoyable experience.

QF52 SIN-BNE 31/8/14 - Singapore lounge was well maintained but busy with the atmosphere of a pub in many parts. Cabin crew were very attentive and helpful and very friendly - Qantas leave other airlines out in the cold when it comes to cabin crew service in business class. Unfortunately the business class seats on this A330 were angled which aren't as easy to sleep on compared to proper lie flat beds. The inflight entertainment on this flight seemed very dated but it was an overnight flight so wasn't a major problem.

We flew Perth to Darwin departure delayed in Perth due to fog so got into Darwin late. Excellent service great breakfast friendly staff fabulous entertainment. We then flew Adelaide to Canberra quick flight. Dinner time was delicious but because of the short flight we didn't get our cup of tea. Canberra to Perth - direct flight great couldn't fault anything except the food. I ordered the red curry and rice and there just wasn't enough. It was so delicious I could have eaten another two or three! I would love the recipe. Departure from Canberra on time and we had an early arrival in Perth which was good as usually there are head winds and we are late. Qantas what a shame you don't fly internationally out of Perth.

SYD-MEL-BNE-SYD sectors. My wife and I travelled the day after Qantas announced its record loss. We weren't quite sure what to expect from the staff but I am so proud of them all they were wonderful. From the ground staff at check-in and the Qantas Business Lounge they were all so friendly professional and courteous. On board they are just great. The service was fantastic.

18 August QF 138 from Christchurch to Sydney QF 922 from Sydney to Cairns on 24 August. QF 923 from Cairns to Sydney and QF 139 from Sydney back again to Christchurch on the same day. My wife and myself booked Qantas from Christchurch NZ to Cairns via Sydney. My wife was in need of a wheelchair. We were so grateful for all the help and kindness of the attendants at the airports as well as on the aircraft. It was a pleasant journey and a wonderful experience.

BNE-AKL return. B737-800. Seated in 4A and 6F respectively. Flights left early and arrived early. Aircraft was clean. Hot meal provided. Crew friendly. Check-in and boarding easy. Inflight entertainment was adequate for these flights. Overall a really good flight.

We flew Perth to Darwin departure delayed in Perth due to fog so got into Darwin late. Excellent service great breakfast friendly staff fabulous entertainment. We then flew Adelaide to Canberra quick flight. Dinner time was delicious but because of the short flight we didn't get our cup of tea. Canberra to Perth - direct flight great couldn't fault anything except the food. I ordered the red curry and rice and there just wasn't enough. It was so delicious I could have eaten another two or three! I would love the recipe. Departure from Canberra on time and we had an early arrival in Perth which was good as usually there are head winds and we are late. Qantas what a shame you don't fly internationally out of Perth.

Melbourne / Perth / Melbourne A330 service on 23 August 2014. Very difficult to find fault. On time departure early arrival in both directions. Aircraft immaculate two meal choices for both breakfast and dinner crew friendly and efficient on near to full flights. Flight over had touch screen video whereas flight back had a slightly older video system with a smaller screen. All this for $250 each way really impressed.

SYD-BKK return. Flight attendants continued to serve alcohol to an obviously already intoxicated man disturbing other passengers. Police called on landing. Also passenger caught several times smoking in toilet despite warnings. Food adequate. IFE very poor and not up too standard of other airlines. Return flight better but departed and arrived late into Sydney. Bag collection very quick. First time I've flown Qantas International and would not do so again.

I flew Qantas before from NZ to OZ - frequently actually and no issues there but never before long haul - Dubai - Auckland. That's where it started - I booked Qantas - but only the Dubai - Auckland leg was actually operated by Qantas (A380) - must have been the oldest and dare I say it largest crew I had on any international flight ever - however they where friendly and very efficient. The plane was half empty so many people managed to get 3 or 4 seats for themselves (sadly not me) and sleep. The food was great - even for Economy and the selection of inflight movies was ok. The problems started when I had to catch my connecting flight to Auckland - operated by JetStar - and what a difference! Middle of the night flight and no pillow or blanket no seats where one could even attempt to sleep on as they do not have head rests that would keep the head where it is - no food either (unless one pays for it and then it's only sandwiches or crisps) - On my online tickets it says by meals (Qantas) - "we offer a wide variety of food" - nothing! The least they could have done is tell their customers. If they do a codeshare that is fine but at least offer the same service.

Qantas really needs to lift their game if they want to compete with the other airlines who are miles ahead in almost every way! The trouble started when they tried to charge me around $150 to book our seat numbers - have never heard of international airlines doing that? I regularly travel to USA and have never encountered that. Travelled to Phuket with the kids and shunned Jetstar (who fly direct) and paid extra to fly Qantas via Bangkok. The kids really had their hearts set on in-seat entertainment and games so we decided the extra money wasn't too much and the extra 4 hours it added to the trip wasn't a big deal if it kept them quiet. Well what a mistake that was! Qantas in-flight entertainment was poor on the way over and non-existent on the way home. Said there was a "Technical Fault" on the return and apologised at the end but really? The planes are just too old. I tried to watch a movie but the "buffering" and jumping made that impossible - I gave up after the 2nd attempt and just went to sleep. Ordered Duty free when the hostess came around approx 40 mins into the trip (6.25pm departure from BKK) and tried my best to stay awake but was woken at 3.30am when she finally arrived with it (but had the order wrong anyway). My daughter opted for the pork for dinner - the hostess had run out and only had chicken and said she'd be straight back with it but forgot - so she was never fed.

I flew on QF1 Sydney to Heathrow mid July 2014 Business class. This flight was fantastic all aspects were up to Qantas's usual standard including the inflight entertainment choices. Being able to watch the Kerry O'Brien interviews with Paul Keating again was a very pleasant way to pass the time. Food and wine were fantastic and the crew personalised the service by using my name this is a nice touch and not all airlines do this. Qantas has the A380 configured as 2x2x2 which is not as good as the 1x2x1 of Singapore airlines but the mattress topper made a difference and the seat became quite comfy for sleeping. All in all a good experience.

QF 1 29 July 2014. QF 10 11 Aug 2014. Was very happy with this airline. I flew from LHR to Dubai and must say it was one of the nicer inflight experiences in quite a while. The crew were friendly and warm. The food served was quite nice and were regularly served refreshments and snacks. The leg room was great compared to a few other airlines. Inflight entertainment other than an annoying radio was good as well.

Flew Brisbane - Hong Kong on August 16. Due to a mix up in online check-in I had been allocated seat 60B nearly the worst seat on the aircraft and impossible to change. At the airport (a 55 minute wait for the 'bag drop') the check-in attendant initially said there was no hope of getting a better seat but eventually managed to find me 27A a window seat in the 'quiet' zone just behind Business. Also an express pass through security. Lunch was served promptly and bottles of water distributed although it was a day flight the window shades were all pulled down. Crew very helpful - endless pot noodles for those who wanted snacks plenty of water and soft drinks passed around and - ice cream. Just before landing was served a very awkward slice of hot pizza - a simple sandwich would have been fine. Overall was just fine.

Flew LAX-SYD on Qantas QF12. An extremely enjoyable flight which I can't say I've ever said about a long haul economy flight! I was lucky enough to score a seat in the upper decks small economy section even luckier I had an entire row to myself allowing me to stretch out and even get 5 hours of sleep! The flight had an entire economy section empty on the lower deck so it was a quiet flight. Staff were great very attentive we had 2 flight attendants looking after our section of just 24 guests! The food as always was economy airline food edible but nothing special. The wine however was great the flight attendant was even giving me a Pinot Gris from the premium section as it was open. The IFE was okay the new releases a were quite limited but the Oscar classics as always were a winner! All in all it was a great flight even managed to clear customs in 15 minutes in sydney! If you can score a seat on the upper deck especially one with extra legroom its almost as good as paying the extra $2000 for premium!

Flew on QF2 from Dubai to Sydney in Economy class. I had the option to get on Emirates EK417 too for the same price (departs after an hour QF2 departs) but took QF2 to reduce the transit time at Dubai and in the end regretted my decision. After making the booking Qantas changed the flight time which reduces the gap between the two flights just to 30 minutes. This was not a big issue however simply put the seat pitch and width made it one of the most uncomfortable long haul journey with my wife and two kids. EK417 seat pitch is 32-34 in with 18in width whereas QF2 seats were 17.5in wide with only 31in pitch hard to move in and out very painful with the front seats reclined. Besides that the service was better than Emirates (flew on Emirates Sydney-Dubai on the same trip). Emirates served meals thrice whereas on QF2 it was twice. Emirates had also an edge with onboard wifi. But in the end the seat pitch mattered the most.

Flew Melbourne to Alice Springs on 737-800. Seat comfort and pitch were fine for a 2 hour flight. Meal was a meat pie which was tasty but crew seemed rather slow with the distribution. Film shown on overhead screens.

Further to my 9 August posting the saga continued. Qantas phoned us on 8th just before we left for Barcelona airport to tell us that our seats were required for a bassinet booking from Dubai to Sydney. When we boarded our flight in Dubai on Friday 8 August there was neither a baby nor a bassinet to be seen. They had simply given our front row seats to two other passengers rather than letting us have our reserved seats back. If this is how the Qantas/Emirates codeshare works I want no part of it. The Purser on the flight was bemused as he told us that they were not expecting any baby or bassinet at 43B and C. Also our flight from Dubai to Sydney was going on to Auckland and the menu for breakfast arriving in Sydney was almost identical to that for the Sydney to Auckland sector just some subtle changes. I have no idea what the Trans-Tasman passengers were actually served as our flight was diverted to Brisbane for fuel when Sydney airport closed due to fog. Our flight arrived in Sydney about 11.00 instead of 06.00. To add insult to injury Qantas could not even get our baggage onto our rebooked flight even though they had six hours to sort it out - not even on the following morning's flight across the ditch.

Flew from Cairns to Melb on a weekday flight which was completely full. The flight was 15 mins late departing but arrived in MEL on time. The crew were friendly and attentive and provided very good service throughout. This looked like a fairly new 737-800 and the quality of the in-flight entertainment and the viewing screen was excellent. As for the meal this was a really pleasant surprise consisting of a nice Moroccan lamb dish followed later by an ice cream. Qantas gets its share of knockers but this flight was certainly up there with the best of any domestic service.

Flew Melbourne to Dubai return with Qantas. Onward journey with Emirates. Return flight from Dubai delayed by 3 hours+. On all legs Qantas service was slow and disorganised. Meal service was reduced as were the drinks. No choice to pick meals either. "Snacks" on all legs were disgusting and mass-produced. Seat selection at online check-in was non-existent. IFE sensitivity was very low. Never again Qantas.

SYD-PER in business class on A330-200. First generation skybed was comfortable for 5 hour flight. Crew promptly met requests but weren't particularly warm. On entering plane CSM was fretting as crew member meant to be at door to plane wasn't there not a good look in front of passengers. Wheels were up at 5.30pm but instead of immediately offering a drink once seat belt sign was up crew did not start serving drinks until 6.30. This isn't good enough for a dinner service in business. Whilst Qantas advertise dining for east-west coast flights as international business selection of dishes a lot less than international flight and not filling which for a dinner flight was a problem and I had to order room service when I arrived in Perth hotel. Overall adequate but not really doing much to lift the bar on this competitive route under pressure from Virgin.

What a fiasco! The Emirates/Qantas partnership works for some but obviously not for my wife and me. We booked flights in January for a regular trip from Wellington to Barcelona and return and reserved our seats at that time. One day prior to our return we have found that our seat reservation for front row on Emirates economy has been cancelled and we are now halfway back in the aircraft from Dubai to Sydney. Phoned Emirates who said that Qantas had changed them and could easily change them back to the original ones. However Emirates could not change them for us. phoned Qantas from France (the callcentre is in Cape Town and Qantas does not even fly there) to be told that Emirates changed them and that Qantas could not change them back. During the conversation the Qantas service agent even changed my seat from row 61 to row 78 and left my wife in row 61 - goodness only knows why! We are both Silver grade FFs and Qantas Club members but it counts for nothing. I am due to make the fifth trip in 18 months on this route and am about to cancel the next one having only booked it three days ago and paid for my seats. Singapore Airlines has never treated us like this on the same route - Wellington to Barcelona and return.

MEL-DBX 24th July. Having flown the ME carriers between Europe and Aus a few times I opted to fly Qantas this time and. I was pleasantly surprised. The A380 looked nice and provided enough room for this 1.90m tall to feel somewhat comfortable during the long flight. Soon after take off they distributed water bottles which was appreciated as nowadays with the rules on bringing fluids in the plane I tend to forget to get that bottle on the other side of customs. Our hostess was very friendly genuinely interested in the passengers she was serving and smiling even at the end of the very long flight. Plenty to choose from the on board entertainment system and a very smooth flight. I will certainly consider flying Qantas again for the long haul flights.

LON to DXB seat 32G - pleasant surprise flying Qantas operated flight on EK ticket. Small economy section upstairs much better than main Econ cabin - only drawback was FA's passing by with service for prem Econ not offered in Econ and having to constantly ask for things. However once asked staff were responsive. Eg. Staff coming by with trolleys of drinks in glass/plastic for prem Econ and then returning with paper cups for economy passengers! No drinks service before meal service but meal was edible and perfectly acceptable. Snack was warmed up pizza still in cardboard wrapper however overall a better experience than EK on the way back and would definitely choose Qantas in preference to EK in future.

Travelled from Sydney to Perth return on business class. Very impressive service over the continent. Offered juice or water prior to take off. Had a choice of 3 entrees 3 mains and 2 desserts on each leg both legs were a lunch service. Food was great as was the choice of beers wines and desert wines. Seat was comfortable enough for the flight and I was provided with a pillow and a blanket. IFE was of international standard with plenty of options. Highly recommended east to west service.

QF702 25th July 2014 from Melbourne to Cairns. The service from the cabin crew to ground staff was outstanding. Meal served was excellent - hot and delivered with a smile from very present young crew member. It's just a pity the airline does not advertise the quality they offer in comparison to their competitors. This is a first class airline that should be supported by all Australian travellers. We will only fly Qantas in future.

MEL-DXB 9 July. The service from Qantas from check-in to landing was warm and efficient and far superior to that of their partners Emirates (who we have had several bad experiences with over the last year or two). There were regular drink runs throughout the flight the food was decent the A380 well maintained and the inflight entertainment was great. The 15 hours flew by! Highly commendable all round.

I returned from Johannesburg South Africa on 25 July 2014. Security was stepped up at JHB airport but was not an unpleasant experience. Boarding went smoothly and so was the flight. Service was great and lots of surprises. I was just very disappointed with the interior of the plane. The seat in front of me on QF64 row 69 was torn and near the service area the plane showed its age. Overall it was a good flight and I will use Qantas again.

QF438 MEL-SYD in Business on B767-300ER. Q streaming product was very average. Incorrect head phones are supplied so that only one ear piece works. They I-Pads have been beaten around and one of ours didn't work properly. The food and service were great but don't think the Q-Streaming is very good at all.

Recent flight Hong Kong flight A380 was a refreshing change. Young crew who genuinely wanted to be there. I had a spare seat next to me which was good as my entertainment was not working even after resets. Not a full flight but very relaxing with the chance to talk to the steward looking after me. Welcomed by name and nothing was too much trouble for him. How I remember Qantas being in the "good old days" . Flight departed late due to weather and loading baggage however we made up a little time. The manager even though he seemed rushed and stressed did keep us in the loop with what was happening. It really was a pleasant journey.

Qantas is an excellent airline (domestically). We were served delicious chicken curry with fresh garlic rice and chocolates wine and bread on our flight's from TSV-BNE-SYD. We had a very new aircraft with the Boeing Sky Interior and PTV's. I also really enjoyed the cabin and ground crews help as I have an amputated-leg.

Flew Darwin to Cairns on Boeing 717. Flight leaves Darwin at 8pm getting into Cairns around 11pm. Dinner is served on this flight hot dish with usual bread roll and dessert in form of cookies brownies or scrolls of some type. Alcohol is served after and not during or before meal service which I think is odd. Service is adequate though I find you need to ring for service more and more on Qantas. Food was fine though beef stew was a bit strange. 717 is quite a comfortable plane flight was good though for a two and a half hour flight and no entertainment prices are quite steep. Used Qantas voucher and points though if we had paid would have come close to $800 return each.

Cairns to Darwin on 717. Dinner flight to Darwin. Qantas Club at Cairns practically empty a bit after 6pm. Food on offer very nice nice wines on offer. Plane full to Darwin managed to get exit row seat. Dinner was pretty good spinach pasta with roast pumpkin and sun dried tomatoes. Flight was on time even though it left a little bit late service fine but always seems to be a long gap before food trays are collected which is a pain when trying to watch I-pad. Overall good flight nothing to complain about.

Flew from Brisbane to Darwin and return Business class. Tired old aircraft crew were excellent both way. Did the same Hawaii - Brisbane must have been the oldest aircraft in the fleet. Wont be flying with them again I hope.

QF12 LAX-SYD Business class. My expectation was high since it was my first QF business class experience in the Airbus 380. As frequent users of European and Asian airlines it was a quiet experience. It seems fellow passengers knows services and facilities very well but I would appreciate some explanation from staff but none. Their service was absolutely minimum. I had to request each time. My largest problem was the seat. Fully flat but there was a hard part at the back which made me very uncomfortable in sleeping position for which I paid a large sum. With regards to food and beverages I skipped dinner and only had a breakfast. Their continental breakfast was the minimum quantity and quality. Overall I left pain with disappointment and back pain.

Flew 747 Business SIN to BNE connecting with my Air France flight from Paris. Flight Attendants were pleasant and helpful and the flat bed seats were comfortable. Food was disgusting and mean! Although the flight departed at 7.20 pm we were offered " supper" which consisted of a small dish of inedible food (dry rubbery pork and tasteless rice) a slice of bread and a tub of ice cream. Breakfast was similarly lacking - choice of a small bowl of muesli or a bowl of fruit or a slice of egg pie and the worst coffee ever! After the wonderful service food and wine on my recent Air France flights Qantas was a disappointment. Worst business class I have flown and one of the most expensive.

Flying with Qantas SYD-BNE-TSV as well as BNE-AKL. All the services that I had received were in my opinion in line with the highest quality (ie: on par with SQ and EK) I had received all options when dining. Departing from Sydney can be a nightmare on even the best airlines however we departed and arrived on time with the feel that each passenger was a person not just a seat number. All in all thank you very much Qantas and you are a spirit of Australia.

SIN-SYD QF6 June 23rd. 1st time with QANTAS best experience in Economy. After an exhausting 24 hour journey with Emirates between Abidjan and Singapore my son and I boarded an old B747 for the last bound to Sydney. 8 hours night flight in an empty cabin. Seats were comfortable food was good wine was excellent IFE offered plenty of recent and good movies and overall cabin Crew was warm and caring the best attention I have had in 40 years of flights. Once again hats off to Qantas.

AKL-HKG via Sydney on 19th July. This was the first time that we had flown with Qantas for many years. The round trip price was excellent and all sectors of the outwards trip were very good. The SYD-HKG sector on the A380 was excellent. Every aspect of the service was first class and staff were always willing to assist in any possible way. Meals were well presented and quite adequate for the journey. Trays were cleared away at regular intervals and regular water runs made throughout the flight. Nothing was too much trouble for this specific crew on this flight. We look forward to our return flight with them in August.

Flew Qantas Sydney to LA on 22nd June 2014. Paid extra for Exit Seats and was not disappointed extra legroom made the 15 hour flight seem less. The FA (Ned) in our area was extremely helpful at all times. Meals were better than we expected. Overall Qantas is by far the best airline we have travelled with and will do so again.

QF10 for LHR-DXB connecting to EK380 from DXB-HKG. The first flight aboard QF10 was excellent. If you compare the Qantas IFE to the ICE entertainment on Emirates I actually found the Qantas one to be slightly more appealing. This is because there were more recent movies that were actually attracting aboard Qantas whereas for Emirates it is just sheer breadth but the amount of movies that I actually wanted to watch was just a handful. As I have a habit of collecting playing cards from airlines I travel with I found it slightly frustrating that you have to actually have to buy it aboard Qantas whereas you get it for free onboard airlines such as LH CX KA EK SQ AY. Nevertheless the seat pitch comfort and food service were top notch for economy. What stood out the most were the most friendliest cabin crew who did not hesitate to help during any time of the flight. As there was a tight connection I love how the ground staff isolated passengers connecting on EK380 upon disembarkation in Dubai so they could speed us through immigration and transfer.

Last leg of a four leg return to Europe with Qantas/Emirates from Dubai to Sydney. My wife and I experienced the best flight service we have had. From the moment we arrived at the door we felt welcome and valued. The crew were friendly without being obsequious efficient without being underfoot and always available. In short nothing was too much trouble. The food was the best I ever had in an airplane and my wife agrees (we had different choices). I have flown many airlines and have yet to experience this quality of service. Although I have always rated Qantas service highly this particular crew rewrote the book on how to treat passengers.

QF971 July 2014 TVS-BNE. Online check in and boarding pass print out no problem. Always experienced good friendly customer service at Townsville Airport. Boarding went smoothly. Seat 26c as requested and husbands requested seat. Usually on Domestic short flights am offered fruit for snack apple usually on flight up to Townsville previous week as need gluten free so it was great to be offered gluten free ham and tomato sandwiches. Cabin crew helpful another passenger had cut on head so offered assistants. Announcement to say why landing slightly delayed. Busy in BNE. This was booked as a Qantas flight using Emirates Skyward miles.
Fantastic service. Food was excellent. Cabin was comfortable. Self-service bars are well stocked with good quality food.

Flew on QF 107 - SYD-LAX-JFK - in premium economy in mid-June. All up a really good experience with really friendly crew plus decent food and wine. It has been a while since I have been on a 747 and I must say that it is a good solid plane. It is louder in-flight than the A380 but it certainly takes off and lands better. The only thing I could fault is the experience at LAX - I got lost transferring here and eventually found my way quite frustrating though. They need to give out an instruction card or have people around directing you where to go. This aspect of it was poorly handled & I am not an inexperienced traveller. All up a very good product though and well worth the money.
SYD-HKG Business class on A380. Very impressive warm service food excellent seat comfortable. Looking forward to flying with Qantas again.

I recently flew to LA from Melbourne on an A380 and the entire experience was wonderful. The sale price of the ticket was great and then the flight was even better. Helpful staff excellent and piping hot food as well as heaps of movies and TV shows made the entire flight a joy. I could not recommend them more highly! The only thing that was a little bit annoying was the default radio channel that plays while you select your viewing options was playing hideous old aussie songs which got a bit irritating after 13 hours.

Jakarta to Sydney in economy class QF 42 on July 6th 2014 and departed on time. Returning on QF 41 on July 16th 2014 but departed a little bit late due to catering. The PTV screen is pretty small and looks cheap. No amenities (toothbrush sock eyes shades etc) were given to the passengers. I can not even find any of these even in the toilet. The toilet only provides liquid hand soap and sanitary napkins. Fortunately the cabin was clean and crews were polite and courteous. Meals were edible. Wines offered were good.

Flew on QF94 from LAX-MEL. The flight was delayed by an hour due to a connecting flight with most of the passengers being late. We pushed back to find there was an issue with a gauge on the aircraft and waited on the tarmac for another hour. The captain and crew kept everyone informed very well. The cabin crew were extremely friendly prompt and professional on the flight. The economy seat is not that comfortable for a 15 hour flight and I found myself walking around a lot more than I should because of that. Food was good for economy as well. Overall a very good flight.

I'm putting in a late review for travel Darwin-Sydney and return in early June because I was impressed by their handling of the ash cloud disruptions. Unlike another airline that completely mishandled my bookings Qantas called me regularly rescheduled flights quickly and allowed free changes to connecting flights that I couldn't make because of a problem with a different airline. That's generally the biggest plus about Qantas - their customer service and ground organisation is efficient and problems are generally resolved quickly. Inflight the experience was good with nothing special. Medium-quality food. Service appears to improved drastically compared to a few years ago. Quality individual IFE on the 737 from Darwin-Sydney but the 737 in the opposite direction didn't have individual IFE - which really seems outdated for a 4 hour flight on a major airline.

QF971 July 2014 TVS-BNE. Online check in and boarding pass print out no problem. Always experienced good friendly customer service at Townsville Airport. Boarding went smoothly. Seat 26c as requested and husbands requested seat. Usually on Domestic short flights am offered fruit for snack apple usually on flight up to Townsville previous week as need gluten free so it was great to be offered gluten free ham and tomato sandwiches. Cabin crew helpful another passenger had cut on head so offered assistants. Announcement to say why landing slightly delayed. Busy in BNE. This was booked as a Qantas flight using Emirates Skyward miles.
Fantastic service. Food was excellent. Cabin was comfortable. Self-service bars are well stocked with good quality food.

Flew Qantas return between Brisbane and Cairns and it was fantastic. Brand new B737's with personal entertainment systems in both directions. The crew were fantastic on both flights. Breakfast and coffee was pretty good and throughout the flight the crew did a few rounds of the cabin offering bottles of water and handing out the extra muffins they had left over. Blankets and pillows were available and we departed and arrived on time. They really exceeded expectations.

SYD-LAX 21/6/14. Great service happy crew A380 great aircraft - quiet and smooth. Food ok hot snack good. Arrived on time. Onward to JFK flight up ok. Flight back to LAX 3/7/14 delayed due to storm boarded aircraft but sat on tarmac waiting. That is acceptable however the temperature in the economy section was dangerous even a crew member said it must be over 40 degrees. Of course the back section was the only hot area. The captain made several apologies but we still roasted. Food on this flight was a disgrace. Crew were great and agreed all was not good. Also the entertainment system had not been changed from the June program. A380 back to SYD 9/7/14 paid extra for exit row on upper deck discovered that this is really a walkway for passengers to get to the toilet. Food once again below standard wine some generic brand and no pre-dinner drinks allowed. One new film had been added to the menu. Service throughout the night was ok breakfast awful not even a bread roll. Overall economy passengers pay a lot of money for this route they do not deserve to be treated like peasants.

Flew QF 78 from Singapore to Perth. I normally fly budget and they were terrible so Qantas was like heaven. Seats were comfy and spacious lots of leg room blankets pillows and staff were friendly. That was one thing that has improved over the years - the friendliness of attendants. The plane was well kept and clean compared to the budget ones. Flight was smooth and on time. Food was so so but no complaints from me. I feel the attitude of the flight attendants still has room for improvement in terms of friendliness and service.

Dubai-Melbourne June 13th terrible service water was served then a wait of 60 mins for anything else. Eventually meals served Sorry no chicken left only Macaroni cheese! International flight. The breakfast was that terrible rubber omelette. Had to wait too long for wine. Why do we have to freeze when I asked FA said nothing can be done about it.

Flew RT economy NYC - Sydney last spring (March 2014). Personal entertainment system was fantastic. Seats were very good (considering I was in economy.) With one exception the attendants were all exceptionally nice. The food was very good and the wine was great. The whole experience was excellent.

A380 HKG-SYD. It was a great flight A380 is steady and fairly quiet. The upper deck is almost entirely devoted to business class it is spacious a flat bed with great service and nice food and entertainment. There is also a lounge for us to relax read magazines watch film and so on. Amenity bag and pyjamas were given out it was overall an impressive experience. Arrival to Sydney was given express card for immigration and custom it was welcoming as it was quite packed at 7am in SYD airport.

Flew QF29 to Hong Kong from Melbourne - great flight good service kept asking for drinks. The entertainment system is really old and our entertainment shut down and we were ignored for 1 hour the head flight attendant gave us $50 duty free vouchers.

Melbourne to Darwin and Alice Springs to Melbourne on B737s. Both flights were smooth and pleasant. Bag drop at Melbourne and check-in at Alice Springs (no check-in kiosks) were easy. Due to strong winds which affected the incoming plane the Alice Springs to Melbourne flight operated about an hour late. On the 4½ hour flight to Darwin a pleasant cold breakfast was served (yoghurt muesli etc) and just before landing a couple of biscuits and mineral water. On the return flight from Alice Springs my vegetarian roll looked better than the squishy meat pies and sauce served to the other passengers. The seats were comfortable enough for the flight sectors. The second flight was booked using Emirates frequent flyer points. Unlike a previous experience there was no problem checking in online via the Qantas (not Emirates) website 24 hrs beforehand.

We travelled to Melbourne from Dubai on QF110 in economy last month. I have flown Qantas for forty years and each time I fly the seats are more cramped and the service is reduced. Never again. My seat 67B would suit a child of 12y or younger. My knees came to within 5cm of the seat in front of me and when the girl in front lowered her seat it was right in my face. I could not stand up to get out of the seat but had to crawl across the seats to get out. I am 70 years old so this distressed me and I could not face 13 hours in such a cramped situation. The staff were kind and as the plane was not full (am I surprised!) my partner agreed to move to another seat freeing up the three seats for me and allowing me to lie down. We had already flown 7 hours from Madrid with a 2hr stop over in Dubai so were very tired. I slept for a few hours on the mini seats but the armrests don't completely disappear so it was very uncomfortable. We had 2 meals in 13 hours all forgettable. However the wine helped. I am not heartless and did swap places with my partner to allow him to lie down too for a while.

QF28 Santiago to Sydney in business. The seat was very very comfortable the service was exceptional and the main course was delicious although not so the rather boring pumpkin empanadas that I chose for starter. Qantas flight attendants are some of the most attentive and professional I have come across. The amenity kit was nice and included what one would expect. The printed menu was a bit too casual and three were left for me which was a bit confusing because they were all different. It took me a while to realise (small letters which I find hard to read) that two were from the previous Sydney to Santiago and Santiago to Rio legs (on 11 June the Rio service was a special for the World Cup). Qantas certainly are well above the average and are different in many ways from other airlines. They try to be so different that they do not have a sign for the Business or First classes check in areas in Australia but instead there is just one in black that says Service. This is annoying and idiotic. I went the length of Sydney domestic terminal trying to find the Business class check in area which of course I did not find and was directed to the 'Service' area by a Qantas employee.

MEL-SYD-SCL. First time with Qantas and liked it a lot. Fast check in great inflight service. Great food with lots of wine. Unusual and very tasty mid flight snack. Comfortable seats and enough legroom. I'll be using them again.

Flew QF702 MEL to Cairns and QF703 Cairns to MEL. The two flights were as different as chalk and cheese. Flight up was not enjoyable at all. The food was an inedible tasteless disappointment with no choice as to what you would like. Lucky we brought some snacks from home! No seatback IFE only a shared boring movie on a screen I could not even see. Come on Qantas entertainment is available on Jetstar for a cost but who cares. How can you expect people to just sit there for 3.5 hours. The small shared screens are an absolute joke. Please either use newer planes with IFE flights 3+ hours or give out ipads Q streaming as is done on the 767. Flight back was on the new VH-XZO with IFE and the food was a lot better and with choice this time. What a difference it was like flying a completely different airline. I really hope these inconsistencies are dealt with. I have always been a fan of our national carrier but why pay more if you are getting less then budget airlines are offering. Will recommend mainly on the basis of safety and punctuality.
Singapore to Brisbane. Old 747 Showing wear and tear. Seats very tight no leg room. Staff not friendly and very slow to serve food. No water run during the 7 hours.

JFK-SYD via LAX. Following my review SYD-DFW I cannot believe Qantas sends an old 747 to New York. Its a 20 hour flight from JFK to SYD via LAX. The seats are like timber and are surprisingly narrow the leg room is minimal entertainment system is terrible and very small screen though food was fine I couldn't wait to get off that flight. Next time I'm flying from JFK I'll just connect to Dallas and fly with Qantas from there Qantas should be ashamed they send such an old 747 to JFK. Why is there no A380 or 747 similar to the Dallas flight.

QF 568 PER-SYD June 17 2014. Boarding was easy. The very seat comfortable good leg room. The food was fine. An overnight flight it was served in a sack of wrapped snacks with juice and fruit. I liked the fact the menu keeps changing and isn't the same year in year out. Drinks were served again before landing. Staff were fine.

Flew business class MEL-CNS 9.30am departure was late due to change of wind. A last minute arrival of a family in business class = parents not seated together so I moved to allow the couple to sit together opposite their two children. I suspect last minute upgrades or Qantas family on standby. The 737-800 was the next gen so very new with very good ambience and good quality entertainment however very poor meal service bread no salad - main was fruit salad or two eggs with chorizo and spinach. Despite a lunch service and 1.30pm arrival wine not offered but I think you could request it. I feel that if I was paying $1000 for the ticket I would feel upset but I was using points to upgrade and so was the passenger seated next to me but he paid double my costs as a last minute booking.
Singapore to Brisbane. Old 747 Showing wear and tear. Seats very tight no leg room. Staff not friendly and very slow to serve food. No water run during the 7 hours.

JFK-SYD via LAX. Following my review SYD-DFW I cannot believe Qantas sends an old 747 to New York. Its a 20 hour flight from JFK to SYD via LAX. The seats are like timber and are surprisingly narrow the leg room is minimal entertainment system is terrible and very small screen though food was fine I couldn't wait to get off that flight. Next time I'm flying from JFK I'll just connect to Dallas and fly with Qantas from there Qantas should be ashamed they send such an old 747 to JFK. Why is there no A380 or 747 similar to the Dallas flight.

Flew SYD to LHR return in economy and I noticed the little extra no longer exist with Qantas in economy. The food on both legs was tasty however the serving size small. The wine was nice and drinkable and no complaints when I asked for refills. Whatever happened to the hot towels? Whilst Qantas still advertise a basic amenities kit on both flights these were not offered. I found the staff service was friendly and efficient. As a gold FF member I put in for points upgrade and was lucky to get short DXB to LHR leg on outbound flight but would seem very hard now to get an upgrade on this flight. The possibility of the upgrade is why I choose Qantas over Singapore Airlines. Return flight home was delayed by 3 hours with an SMS notification which was later updated to inform the flight was on time only to turn up to the airport for and find out the flight was delayed so a 6 hour wait at Heathrow. The flight was only half full so I extra space made the seating more comfortable than it would have if packed in. All in all adequate but there is a reason why flight is half full hard to maintain the brand loyalty when other airline products are similar priced and better.

Flew from Dallas to Sydney on June 14 with a brief stopover in Brisbane. I have nothing but high commendations to the crew and the staff. The service was top notch and nothing was too much to ask for. We had seats 70j and 70k and I am 6 foot and I could fully extend my legs and lock them under without hit my kneecaps on the seat in front. There was plenty of food and snacks. What made the impression was how understanding they were and even if the could not do it they would still try. We immediately went sightseeing because we were so well rested.

QF9 outbound MEL-LHR on 3 June and QF2 inbound LHR to SYD on 13 June both with stops in DXB. Most of my mainline trips to London Dubai Singapore and HK are on Qantas craft. Despite all the criticism I have to say that Qantas on the mainline routes have upped their game. Excellent service from FA's. Meals can be a little inconsistent but have generally found this when the catering is resourced from London in particular. As a comparison my wife travelled out earlier on Emirates also on their A380 service. Same metal but more cramped and an inconsistent level of service from the FA's. No real negatives on either of QF2/9 save the usual gripe about the wait to disembark the A380 which applies to all.

QF2 Heathrow via Dubai to Sydney. Paid a lot for an exit seat but not worth it as on the aisle near the hatch which the crew use to go to their rest station my feet were continually bumped as they queue up to enter the light just in side the door was annoying and the door banged every time so forget any rest. Surprised at the poor quality of food curry or lamb stew on Dubai leg the curry AGAIN or macaroni cheese on Sydney leg. Breakfast was a muffin so arrived in Dubai hungry had to buy breakfast from pain quotidien which was best meal on the trip! Crew were very ordinary. All in all not as good a flight as Thai gave us on same trip 3 months ago. So unless my return flight is much better will use another airline in future.

Canberra-Melbourne return. Although only 45 minutes in the air my ticket for the outbound leg said that dinner would be served. So I was surprised to get a tiny very cold chicken and lettuce sandwich. And that was it. You know what it's fine to not serve a meal on a 45 minute flight but don't say that you will. The crew were terrible. They were miserable rude and surly - with the exception of the cabin manager who was trying hard to make up for the rest of the crew. A passenger in front of me asked for some ice with his drink. The attendant called (yelled) to another attendant in the galley for ice who yelled back down the aisle that there was none. She then made an excuse that no ice is loaded on such short flights. After the fuss died down a miraculous cup of ice was delivered to the man by the cabin manager. Return flight got shifted to an exit row as I was boarding - a nice surprise. Crew were a bit nicer this time but still not great. Short TV show on overhead screens. Planes were clean and well maintained.

Flew Darwin to Perth on 737-800 with winglets. No problem scoring exit row seats and with a hot meal served (which was very nice and a decent serve) plus complimentary beer and wine cannot really complain. I have taken this flight many times and service is always very good and catering better than other flights. Still love the cheese and crackers and ice-cream later on. After Feb flights to Sydney/Melbourne with appalling catering this was a nice return to the Qantas I like and the reason I fly them.

Sydney - Dubai return - A380 - seat 13A. Lounge facilities in Sydney were comfortable and offered an acceptable selection of snacks and drinks. Boarding was efficient. Seating comfortable meals were of good proportion and quality was excellent. Wine selection and quality good. IFE selection was varied and up to date. The addition of the mattress to the seat makes a huge difference and the PJs add to the comfort of sleeping. Service was friendly and relaxed. I think this is the hallmark of flying Qantas. Overall a good product that made for an enjoyable flight.

MEL-SIN on an A330. As a long time QFF I was a little disappointed with many aspects of this flight. Our flight was delayed 2 hours due to 'faulty cockpit part' which had to be flown down from Brisbane. My partner and I travelled in Economy - the seats were dated with little leg room. The entertainment system was old tired and responded poorly to commands from the remote. The food was reasonable with a tasty side salad and a good offering of drinks and wine. Cabin crew were friendly and helpful. The flight was three quarters full so we were able to spread out during meal times. We arrived late but gladly at one of the best airports in the world - Changi. On international routes (aside from its flagship MEL/SYD-DBX-LHR) Qantas compares poorly with competitive modern and innovative Middle Eastern and Asian airlines. I suspect most Australians who fly Qantas do so for the QFF points - which day by day diminish in value and are harder to earn. Particularly on a route to Singapore the options for better cheaper and more modern travel are best serviced by Emirates or Singapore Airlines. Offering the more popular Premium Economy options is one way. More modern aircraft (think: Dreamliners and A380s) and a more diverse menu offering are other helpful ideas. Time to up your game Qantas!

I took Flight QF82 from Singapore to Sydney. The departure time was at 2020 but the flight only departed at around 2100. The personal television was ok and selection of movies was ok. They served dinner and the food was pretty good. The customer service was great as if you just went to the gallery during the flight they would be more than happy to help you. The overall experience was very good.

PER-MEL. We flew these flights last week. The flights were on time and the service was outstanding. The food was delicious and the entertainment was designed to make the time fly. Really great flights!

Absolutely fantastic in every aspect our business class flight from Hong Kong to Sydney was amazing. The flight attendants were very polished and gave exemplary service. The food was good and the seat very comfortable. I cannot complain about a thing. One of the best flights we have ever taken.

Flew MEL-SIN-MEL on QF 35 and QF 36. Staff were professional meals were ok. My travel was booked with a partner airline (who performed the next two legs of the journey) and as such when I tried to purchase extra leg room seating was refused. The only saving grace was that both flights were not full and was able to move to spare seats. Top marks for effort for those on the transfer desk in Singapore. Realistically there is more room between the sates of a V-line country train than economy class on Qantas.

Brisbane to Darwin. Poor tired planes. Outbound ran out of food. Inbound 767 with ipads for the entertainment system. 4 cabin staff to service a 767 who spent most time trying to get the ipads working. Flew Qantas back in 1994 - remember now why we don't fly Qantas. Charging for a beer which can be bought in bulk for a dollar.

LAX-MEL and SYD-DFW. May 2014. The LAX-MEL flight was delayed about an hour or more due to arriving passengers from JFK. The A380 mini Business Class Cabin with three rows is quiet and comfortable. My ear phones were not working and a couple of FA's offered to have me sit in the lounge to watch a movie which I did and they brought me a snack. The device did work afterwards in my seat. The flat bed really helps on a 15 hour flight. The food service was great. FA's were ready to offer any food and beverage throughout the flight. SYD-DFW had a great crew- exceptional attentive personal service. Chose 5J on the reconfigured 747-400ER and love that solo window/aisle seat. Food was good breakfast is the best and presented to you from the galley- not on a cart. ( pancakes fresh fruit smoothie/energiser drink tea toast with jam - you will not find this in the U.S.). Great conversation with a FA during landing as the Crew seat is in front of the 5A/5J seats. Slept for 7 hours on the 14 hour flight love the flat beds and the option for a mattress cover and blanket/pillow to add to the comfort. FA's are so eager to make up the bed unlike Domestic/U.S. airlines. This was one of the best experiences flying internationally second to Cathay Pacific.

SYD-BKK-SYD in Business. I think QF is really stepping up with outstanding service for tough competition. Great customer service on board QF 23/24. Staff are very professional and friendly provide personalised service to business class passengers. Food and wine was very good. First class toiletry bag was given to business class passengers. Sydney first class lounge is fantastic as usual. BKK QF lounge is improved as well. It was excellent flights. Well done QF!

AKL-SYD. Business. Excellent TransTasman early morning flight. A short 3 hours with good personable service good fresh breakfast and actually very good coffee. What singled Qantas out was their help with getting me to a connecting flight in 60 mins. There was a medical emergency on the flight and I thought I would not make the connecting flight. The crew got me off and had someone escort me to my other flight. That was amazing considering this was not a Oneworld partner. Qantas really stood out from the pack!

Flew business New Zealand to Brisbane 25th May. Used points and I am glad we did. If I had paid for this poor excuse for business class I would be more annoyed than I am already. Old scruffy dirty seats that obviously are or were Premium. Food slop (get rid of Perry!) Only two choices of wine? Never would I fly short haul business international ever again with Qantas. So very overpriced and certainly not what you would expect in (supposedly) Business Class. Flew Emirates BNE/Auckland. Chalk and cheese. What business should be! After almost 40 years with Qantas I now give up. I am at the age to want to enjoy comfort when travelling but will be looking at other airlines as if this is business on Qantas - forget it.

SYD/DXB on the A380. Was upgraded using frequent flyer points. A very acceptable product. Very cute little lounge area at the nose of the cabin to chat to passengers over a glass of wine and watch a large TV monitor. Configuration of 2+2+2 is a little more cramped than SIA (see earlier review) but still relatively acceptable. Although seat width is smaller by far the flat bed is very comfortable. Good food and wine. Altogether a great experience if one's upgrade application to use points has been successful. Would definitely choose another off peak flying date and repeat the journey to DXB on the flagship A380.

Same day Brisbane to Sydney (return). Flew down on QF8 (which departs/arrives international terminal) which is a 744 with new interiors. Flight great and a wide selection of IFE. The staff were friendly and even made a mandarin announcement for a Chinese tour group on board while we were delayed at SYD on the tarmac due to a late departing aircraft at our gate. Return trip was QF524 on Boeing 763 with ipads available. Again staff excellent and friendly. Only comment on both flights is that the cost cutting is quite evident with shrinking portions and less options (even at meal times). Overall though the QF domestic experience is outstanding.

Brisbane-Los Angelesand Dallas Brisbane in Premium Economy. Worth the extra price. Great service attentive staff who go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. The extra space gives you more room to stretch. These may be challenging times behind the scenes but I didn't feel it as a passenger.

QF3 and QF4 Sydney/ Honolulu return. Having read the dire reports of this particular route we went equipped with an extra inflatable cushion each plus a neck roll. The seats were not as bad as we expected although as cramped as you would expect in Economy. The price for travelling Business on this route is outrageous. Boarding at Sydney was a complete shambles. All the departure boards announced that the gate was open. However when you arrived at the gate there was a surly security man ordering everyone to sit in a holding bay next to the gate. Countless people turned up at the gate and explained that the boards said it was open to be given no explanation but ordered to sit elsewhere. The problem was that there was a JetStar flight to Honolulu that was late leaving and all their passengers were also in the holding bay. There was not one announcement as to what was going on. Occasionally a passenger would be called by name and allowed through but the rest of us had to stand and endure the glare from the security man. Eventually a woman security person turned up and was much more amenable but was muttering about 'security' procedures. Eventually they opened the gate and all the passengers went through. By this time the Qantas and Jet Star passengers were all mixed up and of course after the Jetstar flight had been called and was about to close there was one poor passenger who was still mingling in with the Qantas passengers and almost missed his flight! It was then announced that it was the 'late arrival of the cleaners' that had caused the problem. Total shambles. Onboard the cabin crew were cheerful and willing to help. The service of drinks is a bit bizarre they don't serve a drink before the meal so if you don't want wine (which was vile) you end up having a gin and tonic or other aperitif with your meal. Or not as the case may be. On the return leg I asked for a G & T they said they would bring one back but never did. I couldn't be bothered to ask again. The food was fairly awful. My husband had something described as pearl cous cous it looked like spider's eggs and tasted of nothing! The ice cream after dinner was the best part of the meal service. The Ipads are a complete waste of time the sound is terrible and after trying to get two or three to work we gave up. The staff must hate them as they seem to spend a lot of time sorting them out! On the way back boarding at Honolulu was very well organised. The plane was full but the cabin staff again were very good. Two of the call buttons got stuck and kept pinging every few seconds for about two hours but eventually they managed to stop the noise. Again the food was forgettable. All flights were on time and we arrived safely so that's what counts but 10 hours was quite long enough!

SYD-SCL (Santiago)-SYD on QF27/28 again in Premium Economy. This almost feels like a 'flagship route' for Qantas these days. These flights are excellent and interesting and offer (if one is lucky) unbelievable views of the Antarctic Ice Shelf especially at this time of the year as the aircraft follows the necessary 'Great Circle Route' to and from Australia. Top professional service and a sense of a quality product on these 747 flights .I only wonder why Qantas doesn't offer Premium Economy Seating on its A330 flights into Asia as does Cathay Pacific. I'm sure it would be a winner.

Melbourne to Sydney and onto Hawaii and back on QF3 and QF4. After boarding found that the aircraft was older than others however we did not have an issue with the seating or leg room the service and meals were more than satisfactory and the crew were fantastic on both flights. If you would like to be critical the iPads take a while to get working if they don't work all together the cabin crew are very quick to replace it with another most of the time it was just a matter of turning it off and re booting. Both the domestic flights were also good as we travelled with a family of four we also found the baggage allowance of two check ins per person by 23 kg fantastic. When booking the flights our travel agent got Qantas as the cheapest out of Virgin Hawaiian and Jetstar.

Attendants will ply you with excellent Aussie wine and very good food. Snacks galore. Unlimited choices on your TV. They provided plenty of blankets and pillows and the first leg was not crowded and they had no problem that I stretched out across 3 seats and slept a few hours.

QF28 from Santiago to Sydney on 12th May was a dream trip. Staff very attentive personalized service and great seat comfort. Cabin staff even suggested I try to get on an earlier flight from Sydney to Melbourne after clearing customs and immigration which got me home 1 hour before schedule.

Sydney to Melbourne. After an overnight JAL flight from Tokyo to Sydney I connected with a QANTAS domestic to Melbourne. I made the mistake of taking carry on luggage that was way too heavy. The staff were quite understanding and arranged for it to be stored until the plane landed in Melbourne . It says something of the quality of the staff that they were understanding and patient when a mistake like this is made by a customer. The breakfast served was very good and quite substantial for such a short flight. Good IFE as well.

Brisbane to Auckland on B737-800. Business section was poorly maintained. Sticky residue from unknown source all over my seat and entertainment controls. The entertainment monitor was difficult to get out (bent or damaged fittings perhaps?). Staff appeared tired and unenthusiastic food on par with cafeé food (stale tasteless). Service is inconsistent. Bit of pot luck whether you will get reasonably good or poor service. Loose panels on wall and disgusting state of washroom suggest Qantas is cutting spending on maintenance and cleaning. I'm now one of the growing number of Australians who say "anyone but Qantas" when booking an international flight.

LAX to BNE on Boeing 747-400. Business class (upstairs). Poor service from uninterested crew. This was once a great airline now service is just so inconsistent it's a joke. Even though this was I believe a refurbished plane the layout looks third world compared to say Emirates business class. Qantas fare prices don't seem competitive and poor value for money.
